alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 22 at 4:14AM EST until December 24 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM EST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Watch, 2 to 4 of inundation above ground level possible in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from noon Thursday to 6 AM EST Saturday. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from Friday morning through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
